meanings.definition: The middle of the night; the period of time between midnight and dawn.
meanings.sent1: During the midwatches, the moon shines brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were on duty during the midwatches of the night.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest are quiet during the midwatches, as if they are also sleeping.
meanings.sent4: In the midwatches, the world seems to hold its breath, waiting for the first light of dawn.
meanings.sent5: The midwatches are a mysterious time when shadows dance in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: To keep watch or guard during the middle of the night.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers midwatches the castle to ensure its safety.
meanings.sent2: She midwatches the neighborhood every night to prevent any mischief.
meanings.sent3: The cat midwatches the house, ready to pounce on any intruders.
meanings.sent4: He midwatches the campsite like a vigilant guardian, protecting his friends.
meanings.sent5: Midwatches can be tiring, but it is crucial to stay alert for any dangers.
